messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] J names
messages.msgSnippet: LOL I was exactly the same way with my third! DH called her Cassidy (which I did NOT like) from the moment we found out she was a girl, and the boys added
messages.messageBody:
LOL I was exactly the same way with my third! DH called her Cassidy (which I did NOT like) from the moment we found out she was a girl, and the boys added Belle.... they were constantly saying "Cassie Belle" to my belly, and it grew on me. After that, none of the other names I'd picked out seemed "right" so we have our little Cassidy Belle now, and I can't imagine her named anything else.
Myranda

That's funny. I didn't like the name Jared at all when dh mentioned it.
Trevor (oldest boy) loved it and they both started referring to my bulging
belly as "Baby Jared" by four months into the pregnancy.
I kept saying that NO we were not going to name this baby Jared, it was going
to be Connor or Donovan or something a bit Irish.
But after months of them talking to the little guy and calling him Jared, it
grew on me.
The moment they laid that wet newborn on my chest I said "baby Jared" and
sighed. Dh looked at me and said "we have to name him Jared now"....the deal
was sealed.

Ren

messages.subject: J names
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/7/02 2:34:54 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/7/02 2:34:54 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Forgot to mention...Kyle would have been either a Jared or a Justin if
I had my way, but dh did not like the idea of having a family of all
J names (dh is Jeff, oldest is Jason). Ah well... >>

That's funny. I didn't like the name Jared at all when dh mentioned it.
Trevor (oldest boy) loved it and they both started referring to my bulging
belly as "Baby Jared" by four months into the pregnancy.
I kept saying that NO we were not going to name this baby Jared, it was going
to be Connor or Donovan or something a bit Irish.
But after months of them talking to the little guy and calling him Jared, it
grew on me.
The moment they laid that wet newborn on my chest I said "baby Jared" and
sighed. Dh looked at me and said "we have to name him Jared now"....the deal
was sealed.

Ren
